thread.title: Updated Illini football bowl game projections
thread.title_full: Updated Illini football bowl game projections

author: paulmbanks
title: Updated Illini football bowl game projections
text:
Tweet 
Big morale victory for Illini football on Saturday; sort of. Consider how depleted Illinois is at the skill positions right now, and yet how close they came to beating an undefeated Iowa Squad: With 2 of their top 3 WR's and RB's out, Illinois beat Nebraska and hung with (22) Iowa on the road. (Dudek/Hardee/Brown/Ferguson out) 
— Illini Update (@IlliniUpdate) October 10, 2015 
At the bye week, Illini football is not 4-2, and that means they just need to go 2-4 down the stretch to go bowling again (no six win Big Ten team will ever be home for the holidays in this new era of bowl expansion, don’t be shocked if a five win team somehow goes as well). 
Likely wins: @Purdue Nov 7 
Likely losses: Ohio St. Nov 14, @Penn St Oct. 31 
Could go either way: Wisconsin October 24th, @ Minnesota Nov 21st, Northwestern @ Solider Field Nov 28th 
My weekly Northwestern and Illini football segment on KOZN Omaha 1620 The Zone: 
You should probably hear Ron Johnson’s segment talking smack about the state of Nebraska too. That’s what led to joke in the intro: 
So which bowl is Illinois headed to? It’s still mid October but here’s what they’re saying. 
Palm, CBS : Quick Lane, Detroit, December 28th vs Pittsburgh 
Bleacher Report: Armed Forces, Ft. Worth, December 29th vs UL-Lafayette 
SB Nation: Poinsettia, San Diego, December 28th vs Boston College 
McMurphy, ESPN: Pinstripe, New York, December 26th vs Pittsburgh 
Schlabach, ESPN: Quick Lane, vs N.C. State 
On a side note, let’s hope Bill Cubit never calls another play in which WR Geronimo Allison throws a pass. When I saw that, my thought was…. 
We’ll be updating this every week, possibly adding more projections as they come in. So watch this space Illini football fans. 
If you have bowl projection, and it’s not listed here, email and/or Tweet it to me @paulmbanks and thesportsbank DOT net AT gmail DOT com.
